alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 11:55AM MST until September 10 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Burn Scar and Government Tank Watershed... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 300 PM MST /400 PM MDT/. * At 1153 AM MST /1253 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Wupatki Trails, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Fernwood, Timberline, Hutchison Acres, Doney Park, Sunset Crater Visitors Center, Lockett Meadow Campground and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 440. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash, San Francisco Wash, Hulls Wash, Ball Court Wash, Schultz Creek and Kanaa Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent downstream of the Pipeline Fire scar, including Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Hutchinson Acres, Macann Estates and Doney Park. Ash and debris-filled waters will impact roads, including Highway 89. Shelter in place until the waters recede. Stay out of flood waters!
